H0.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Platform

H1.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Charter

H2.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Declaration

H3.text: What name is given to the declaration of aims and policies of a political party before an election. Manifesto

A4.text: In the United Kingdom and certain other countries, the party platform is referred to as the party's 'manifesto' or political programme.

A5.text: A political party platform (North American English), party program, or party manifesto (preferential term in British and often Commonwealth English) is a formal set of principal goals which are supported by a political party or individual candidate, to appeal to the general public, for the ultimate purpose of garnering the general public's support and votes about complicated topics or issues.

A6.text: Electronic Manifestos Canada â€“ Manifestos of Canada's major political parties since 1949

A7.text: National Party Platforms of the United States, Presidential Candidates, Electoral and Popular Votes 1896

A8.text: A manifesto is a written declaration of the intentions, motives, or views of the issuer, be it an individual, group, political party, or government.

A9.text: Manifestos relating to religious belief are generally referred to as creeds or confessions of faith.
